Event.name: Breaking_out_captive
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> brings about the end of a <fen>Theme</fen>'s captivity at a <fen>Location_of_confinement</fen> in contravention of the plans or desires of a captor.
<ex><fex name="Agent">His accomplice</fex> <t>freed</t> <fex name="Theme">him</fex> <fex name="Location_of_confinement">from Sing Sing prison</fex> <fex name="Means">thanks to his disguise</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Age">The police</fex> <t>freed</t> the suspect.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the person or object in motion released by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex>The police <t>freed</t> <fex name="Theme">the suspect</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the release which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The police <t>freed</t> the suspect <fex name="Manner">carefully</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The action of the <fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the release.
<ex>He <m>set</m> the entire convoy of prisoners <t>free</t> <fex name="Means">by bribing the guards</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> identifies the reason for which the <fen>Agent</fen> releases the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The police <m>set</m> the suspect <t>free</t> <fex name="Explanation"> because he had a good alibi</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> release the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ceases to be confined.
<ex>"Aren't you going to <t>free</t> us <fex name="Place">here</fex>?" she asked.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Location_of_confinement
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion was formerly inhibited.
<ex>Rebels <m>set</m> three prisoners <t>free</t> <fex name="Loc">from holding cells</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Concessive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world when the Releasing event occurs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: break out.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: set a captive free against the wishes of the captor.

lexUnit.name: free.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To release from confinement imposed.by others
